subtitleNullable: Intelligent System Research Group Bina Darma Dataset
descriptionNullable:
The handwritten Komering  script dataset is available on this page, this dataset consists of two datasets, namely the original dataset consisting of 26,614 training data files and 18,000 test data files. The second dataset is an argumentation dataset, which is a modification of the original dataset which was generated by the augmentation technique.
There are two files on this page, namely:
Train_asli.zip : training set images without any arguments (405,254,847 bytes)
Test_asli.zip : training set images without augmentation (xxxxx bytes).

Files can be downloaded and then uncompressed. Image files use the standard jpg and png formats. To read it can be read with a simple program.
The image file is written in black and white (bilevel) Komering script that has not been compressed. The classification technique that has been tried shows that the accuracy value obtained can reach >99% depending on the algorithm and pre-processing method used.

Komering script itself consists of 28 basic characters that have 12 variants of vowels or punctuation marks that change the reading of the characters. With these vowel variants, there are 336 character variants collected. The determination of the variants of characters that were collected and examples of their writing involved sources from the 'Komunitas Pecinta Aksara Ulu', South Sumatra.
This data was taken by collecting 100 handwriting patterns from 100 respondents who imitated the script consisting of 336 characters. Respondents themselves were determined by purposive sampling technique with a range of age variants from 9 years to 50 years.
title: Komering_(Ulu)_Characters_Datases
